# STC Fines
## Fining a Shuttle
When a shuttle commits an offense at your designated station of operation they are issued a [color=#cb0000]Fine[/color] of which usually depicts their offense and how much the owe. Fines are usually collected and enforced by [color=#cb0000]Colonial Security[/color]
## Fine Reasons
The [color=#1b67a5]Overseer.[/color] sets the price for fines and what counds as a valid citation reason, however if there is no [color=#1b67a5]Overseer.[/color] or they allow you to choose your own, heres some standard ones for citations. - Improper Docking Procedures ($10,000) (Docking without authorization or permission.) - Improper Undocking Procedures ($20,000) (Bumping or hitting other ships or the station.) - Failure to enable IFF at 300 meters ($10,000) - Failure to Hail at 200 meters ($10,000) - Failure to Maintain Attention ($10,000) (Failing to monitor radio communications, loitering or being docked for more than 20 minutes without permission.) - Failure to Respond to Space Traffic Controller ($10,000) (Failing to Respond to STC in a timely manner)
## Issuing fines
Fines can be issued in a few ways, either by notifying over broadband, informing [color=#cb0000]Colonial Security[/color], or sending a Fax to the shuttle.
